channel.title: Client 'path specified' error whilst compileing
channel.description:
Oke, well I try to compile after some editing and I get error message : The system cannot find the path specified. Press any key to continue.
Help please anyone ? :( :confused:[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 25, 2009, 06:00:44 am[/size][hr]Nevermind :S I have done it - Staff please lock or remove?

item.title: Client 'path specified' error whilst compileing
item.dc:creator: @Agent766 Agent766
item.description:
@Agent766 wrote:

You don’t need them to be set. It just depends on the batch file you’re using to launch it. Grundy’s file will actually locate your JDK installation (vishkl, you need the JDK. the JRE wont do.). You need the environmental variables set so you can use java *.java (use java with out the path). Otherwise all you have to do is specify the path to your java/javac executable (i.e. C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\javac.exe).

Read full topic

item.title: Client 'path specified' error whilst compileing
item.dc:creator: @gta547653 gta547653
item.description:
@gta547653 wrote:

grundy you forgot to mention the environment variables because those are what allows it to run without it you can never compile a server, or run it for that matter.

Read full topic

item.title: Client 'path specified' error whilst compileing
item.dc:creator: @grundyboy34 grundyboy34
item.description:
@grundyboy34 wrote:

that should work but this is the code i always use it compiles and runs

@echo off
title Server or Client Name
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
cls
color 04
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
cls
color 04
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
cls
color 04
echo My-Escape Client Compiled!
goto run
:run
color 02
JAVA -Xmx500m EGUI
pause

put that in the compiler and save
that should always work and you shouldnt have to change it after a java update

Read full topic

item.title: Client 'path specified' error whilst compileing
item.dc:creator: @vishkl vishkl
item.description:
@vishkl wrote:

ok 1st have u got JDK or JRE if so edit the compiler and where it says jdk1.6.0 or jre1.6.0 or w/e just edit it to what u got for instance like say u dl JDK version 14 type there jdk1.6.0_14 try that

Read full topic
